title: 2 Simple Ways to Use Control F on an iPhone

steps.title: Open a webpage in Safari.
steps.content: Open a webpage in Safari. You can also use another mobile browser, such as Google Chrome . You can also search PDFs, but they must be open in Safari or Chrome.

steps.title: Tap "Share".
steps.content: Tap "Share". This will be at the top or bottom of the screen, depending on your browser. A pop-up menu will open.

steps.title: Tap Find on Page.
steps.content: Tap Find on Page . You may need to drag the menu upwards to see this option. This can also look like Find in Page or similar depending on your browser.

steps.title: Enter a word or phrase.
steps.content: Enter a word or phrase. Make sure to spell things correctly. If needed, you can tap the magnifying glass icon and select Whole Words and/or Match Case to narrow down your search. Results will load as you type.

steps.title: View the results.
steps.content: View the results. Tap the down-arrow to go to the next result, and tap the up-arrow to go to the previous result. When you're finished, tap Done to return to the webpage.

steps.title: Open the Messages app.
steps.content: Open the Messages app . This looks like a white text bubble with a green background. [1] X Research source By default, your list of conversations will open. If you're in a conversation, tap the back arrow to return to this page.

steps.title: Swipe down.
steps.content: Swipe down. This will open the search field.

steps.title: Tap the search bar and enter a word or phrase.
steps.content: Tap the search bar and enter a word or phrase. Results will load as you type.

steps.title: View your results.
steps.content: View your results. You'll see them listed from newest to oldest. If needed, tap See All to view all results containing the words or phrases.
